SENT.plain: Self-injection of mercury can be life-threatening
We report a case of attempted suicide by self-intravenous injection of elemental mercury
The patient suffered from two side effects : membranous nephropathy and aplastic anemia
She was treated and the systemic effects of mercury were reversed after 4 years
The toxicology of mercury, mechanisms of renal and systemic toxicities, and the various therapeutic measures for mercury poisoning are discussed
